rating_scales.description: The process is followed for all critical asset tasks.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: The process always followed for all assets.

questions.title: Tactics Change Management
questions.question_text:
1. Is the ability to change tasks or intervals tightly controlled?
2. Does everybody understand the processes?
3.  Is there a form required before any changes can be made?
questions.context:
Change Management
Change Management procedures are crucial to ensure maintenance tasks & procedures comply with the selected methodology (e.g., RCM, FMECA,  PMO) principles
• Safety
• Materials
• Tasks including specification.

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: There no change management procedures or here is an informal change management process in place that requires notification to reliability group of any changes to PM/tasks.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Change Management procedure requires a reliability engineer to review and approve all changes to PM/tasks no formal  consideration given to actual failure modes and business requirements.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Change Management procedure requires a reliability engineer to review and approve all changes to PM/tasks with consideration given to actual failure modes and business requirements.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: Change Management procedures requires  all changes to PM/tasks to be based on the selected methodology e.g., RCM, FMECA, PMO.

questions.title: Asset Performance Monitoring
questions.question_text:
1. Are Pareto charts used?
2. Are there reports available comparing expected performance vs revised Asset Tactic Development expected performance?
3.  Is there an active review of failure information for new failure modes?
questions.context:
Asset Performance Review
 A continuous process of improving maintenance tactics requires the monitoring of various sources of information on equipment performance and task effectiveness:
• Cost Reports
• Trend Analysis
• Failure Analysis
• Tactics Review
• Defect Elimination
• Integrity Risk Assessment.

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: Tools such as pareto analysis charts reviewed intermittently to identify emerging issues.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Analysis of equipment performance metrics are used regularly.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Various metrics and proactive risk assessments (e.g., FMEA) are used to identify emerging issues and opportunities to improve tactics in advance.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: Robust Lifecycle costing analysis in place. Combined cost, procurement, maintenance, operations & disposal.

questions.title: Preventive Maintenance Optimization
questions.question_text: Have equipment tactics been reviewed to change, eliminate or extend intervals of tasks? Does Senior Management?
questions.context:
PMO (Preventative Maintenance  Optimisation)
PMO is a review of equipment performance to determine the effectiveness of tactics already in place and:
• Maybe used for equipment with significant history and well understood life cycles
• Is a method to rapidly review current tactics in bulk.

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: PMO is not or is sometimes used to optimize equipment tactics for equipment with well-understood failure modes.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: PMO is regularly used to optimize equipment tactics for equipment with well-understood failure modes.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: PMOs are widely used. There has been a PMO activity completed & effectively implemented in the last 36 months.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: PMOs are widely used. There has been a PMO activity completed & effectively implemented in the last 12 months.

questions.title: Cross-Site Collaboration
questions.question_text:
1. Does Senior Management encourage people to work together on Asset Tactic Development projects?
2. Does Senior Management feel responsible for the performance of the Asset Tactic Development process?
questions.context:
Collaboration
Collaboration is important to share information and resources across organizations to help improve Asset Tactic Development outcomes.  Collaboration can come in many forms:
• Asset Management (AM) engagements
• Common Practice Work Groups (CPWGs)
• Multi-Site Projects.

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description:
Little or no evidence of any collaboration activities.
Individuals in key roles have ad hoc contacts with other sites to review or discuss tactics work.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Key individuals have access to on-line groups or forums.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Key individuals are part of a Common Practice Work group.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: Key individuals are consulted or involved in multi-site tactics development projects.

questions.title: DE Integration with Asset Tactics
questions.question_text:
1. Does a Defect Elimination process exist?
2. Are recommendations for tactics improvement from the Defect Elimination process reviewed and incorporated into existing tactics?
3. Are tactics changes generated by the Defect Elimination process reviewed and approved prior to implementation?
4. How often are tactics changed to as an outcome of a DE project? Do you have an example of this?
questions.context:
Asset Tactics Integrated with Defect Elimination           
 A process exists to ensure recommendations for tactics improvement generated from the Defect Elimination process are reviewed and incorporated into existing asset tactics.

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: No Defect Elimination process exists. Or, Defect Elimination process exists, but no integration of Defect Elimination recommendations into Asset Tactics Development process.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Some integration of Defect Elimination recommendations into Asset Tactics Development process.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Defect Elimination recommendations for changes to tactics are integrated into the Asset Tactics Development process.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: Defect Elimination recommendations for changes to tactics are fully integrated into the Asset Tactics Development process, including a review and approval of the recommendations prior to implementation.

questions.title: Asset Health Information Management
questions.question_text: How are changes to the Asset Health program tracked. i.e. changed Fmax from 500Hz to 1000Hz?
questions.context: Asset Health information Storage and Sharing

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: Asset Health information is not readily accessible. Asset Health information is stored at scattered locations and is hardly accessible.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Asset Health information is stored at various specified locations and is accessible.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: All Asset Health information is stored at a common location and is accessible for certain people.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: All Asset Health information is stored at a common location and is readily accessible via electronic media for all concerned.

questions.title: Asset Health Program Ownership
questions.question_text: How do you know what you have?
questions.context: Asset Health Ownership

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: No system in place - Informal process; no documentation.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: A system in place and but not effectively followed.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: A system is  in place, documented and followed most of time  to ensure appropriate people take ownership of Asset Health activity.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: A system is  in place, documented and followed all of time  to ensure appropriate people take ownership of Asset Health activity. Asset Health Champion in place and active participation during meeting/reviews.

questions.title: Asset Selection Process
questions.question_text: Have visual inspection routes been established?
questions.context: Asset Selection Process

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: No process in place to select equipment and rely on OEM recommendations.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: informal process based on 'experience' for selecting equipment. Often list provided by customer.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: A formal AS&T development process where vendor/consultant review equipment to be in Asset Health program.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: An approved rigorous process is used in identifying the correct equipment to receive Asset Health surveys (including criticality reviews).

questions.title: Equipment Access Management
questions.question_text: How are actionable items reported back to the Asset Health team.
questions.context: Condition Based Maintenance Access

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: No system in place to address access issues and only 25% of equipment that requires Asset Health can be accessed safely.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: A system in place to address access issues and 50% of equipment that requires Asset Health can be accessed safely.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: A system in place to address access issues and 75% of equipment that requires Asset Health can be accessed safely.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: A system in place to address access issues and all equipment that requires Asset Health can be accessed safely.

questions.title: Inspection Route Management
questions.question_text: Is the information (data) centralised?
questions.context: Condition Monintoring Inspection Routes

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: None to a few Asset Health inspection routes have been established.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Asset Health inspection routes have been established for Critical and some equipment and followed for routine inspections.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Asset Health inspection routes have been established for Above Rail and Non-rail equipment and are always followed for routine inspections

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: Asset Health inspection routes have been established for all Company equipment and are all followed for routine inspections.

questions.title: Stakeholder Training and Awareness
questions.question_text: Have the stakeholders had any awareness training or background in Asset Health?
questions.context: Stakeholder Understanding

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: Understanding amongst stakeholders about Asset Health processes and their value are misunderstood and there is little or no understanding about Asset Health processes and their value.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Stakeholders understand the value and technology for some of the Asset Health processes.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Above Rail and Non-rail Stakeholders understand the value and technology for the Asset Health processes and have integrated Asset Health  appropriately into some equipment maintenance tactics.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: Company Stakeholders understand the value and technology for all of the Asset Health processes and have integrated Asset Health  appropriately into all equipment maintenance tactics.

questions.title: Skills Development and Training
questions.question_text: Is there a process in place for continuing development in condition monitoring and analytical skills amongst the teams?
questions.context: Skills & Knowledge

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: No formal training or process in place. New technicians informally trained by existing staff.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: New technicians formally trained prior to commencing.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Refresher training is formally provided on a regular and as needed basis.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: Professional development supported with peer interaction encouraged.

questions.title: Asset Health Information Accessibility
questions.question_text: How accessible is Asset Health information to shop floor personnel?
questions.context: Asset Health / asset condition general information

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: Asset Health information exists but not clear or accessible.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Asset Health information hard to access.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Asset Health information readily accessible via electronic media across Above Rail and Non-rail taking into account numerious sources of data

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: Asset Health information readily accessible via electronic media across Company taking into account numerious sources of data

questions.title: Failed Component Analysis
questions.question_text: Are failed components retained and sufficient root cause failure analysis completed?
questions.context: Failed Component Retention

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: Failed components are retained ad-hoc. 25% of all failures are retained for Failure Analysis.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: 50% of all failures are retained for Failure Analysis.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: 75% of all failures are retained for Failure Analysis.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: All failures components under a Asset Health program are retained for a full failure analysis

questions.title: RCA Implementation and Documentation
questions.question_text: To what extent are RCA performed?
questions.context:
Root Cause Analysis (RCA) Information
From CMMS data

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: RCA is not carried out consistantly using a systematic methodology. Principles of RCA are utilized on occasion but application and reporting is not utilized.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Principles of RCA are utilized but application and reporting is inconsistent.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Most RCA reports are detailed and accessible.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: All RCA reports are detailed and readily accessible.

questions.title: Planning and Scheduling Integration
questions.question_text: How does the Asset Health team interface with P&S?
questions.context: Asset Health Integration with Maintenance Planning & Scheduling

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: Asset Health representative has little or no contact with Planners, and Schedulers but do not attend weekly scheduling meeting.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Asset Health representative has some contact with planners and schedulers.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Asset Health representative has good contact with planners and schedulers and is present at scheduling meeting when significant failures/finds occur.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: Asset Health representative has excellent contact with planners and schedulers and is always  present at weekly scheduling meetings.

questions.title: Failure Documentation Standards
questions.question_text:
1. Are failures well documented sufficiently to allow future reliability analysis?
2. Do they include failure modes and all other relevant information?
questions.context: Failure Recording

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: Failure modes not consistantly recorded in work order. 25% of critical failures are documented properly.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: 75% of critical failures are documented properly.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: 100% of critical failures are documented properly.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: All failures are recorded properly in a consistent manner.

questions.title: Reliability Engineering Collaboration
questions.question_text: What level of interaction occurs between Asset Health tech's and Res?
questions.context: Asset Health Tech's Access to RE

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: Asset Health have little or no access RE's.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Asset Health have access to and are updated on RCA information upon request.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Asset Health have access to and are updated on RCA information.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: Asset Health have full access to and are always updated on RCA information.

questions.title: Recommendation Implementation
questions.question_text: When a recommendation for corrective action is made; what happens?
questions.context: Asset Health Recommendations - Actioning

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: Asset Health recommendations are not followed and routinely acted upon.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Asset Health recommendations are valued but tend to be pushed out when there are conflicting priorities.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Most recommendations are actioned  within the required timeframe considering criticality.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: All Asset Health recommendations are actioned  within the time frame required.

questions.title: Stakeholder Feedback Management
questions.question_text: Have the stakeholders been identified?
questions.context: Stakeholder Feedback

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: No stakeholders have been identified. No stakeholder feedback is sought or given.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Stakeholder Feedback is sought occasionally.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: A system in place to ensure Above Rail and Non-rail stakeholders feedback is given by and it is always acted upon.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: A system in place to ensure All Company stakeholders feedback is given by and it is always acted upon.

questions.title: Asset Health Reporting Standards
questions.question_text: Do Asset Health reports exists and are they standardised?
questions.context: Asset Information

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: Less than 25% of monitored equipment has completed data sheets.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: 50% of monitored equipment has completed data sheets.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description:
75% of monitored equipment has completed data sheets. 
100% of critical equipment has completed data sheets.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: Accurate detailed data sheets available for all equipment under Asset Health surveys.

questions.title: Recommendation Tracking Systems
questions.question_text: How do you know when something is repaired or replaced once a recommendation is acted upon?
questions.context: Asset Health Recommendations - Tracking

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description:
Asset Health recommendations are not tracked.
Plan/methodology has not been fully developed for tracking status of recommendations.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Plan/methodology has been developed for tracking status of recommendations. Working on deployment.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: A consistent methodology is used to track the current status of most recommendations

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: A consistent methodology is used to track the current status of all Asset Health recommendations

questions.title: Continuous Improvement Process
questions.question_text: How do you know if your equipment is in calibration or not?
questions.context: Asset Health Continuous Improvement

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: Asset Health self-audit tools not readily  available. Some Asset Health self-audit tools are available but not used to identify improvement opportunities.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Some Asset Health self-audit tools are available and occasionally used to identify improvement opportunities. Improvement opportunities  not often actioned.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Asset Health self-audit tools are available and often used to identify improvement opportunities. Most Improvement opportunities actioned.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: Asset Health self-audit tools are available and regularly used to identify improvement opportunities. Improvement opportunities are always actioned.

questions.title: Change Management Process
questions.question_text: Are they rushed to judgment when it comes to analysis?
questions.context: Asset Health Change Management

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: Changes to Asset Health program not documented. Overall Asset Health procedure in place but not utilized.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Some changes are documented.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Most Major changes to Asset Health program are documented using a change management process.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: All Changes to Asset Health program are documented using a change management process.

questions.title: Value Communication and Recognition
questions.question_text: How are 'wins' or 'saves' acknowledged?
questions.context: Asset Health value add

rating_scales.name: Reactive
rating_scales.description: Asset Health value add is not or rarely publicised.

rating_scales.name: Planned
rating_scales.description: Asset Health value add is publicized occasionally in one way or another.

rating_scales.name: Proactive
rating_scales.description: Asset Health value add is often publicized in one way or another.

rating_scales.name: Optimised
rating_scales.description: Asset Health value add is regularly publicized and promoted in readily accessible media.

assessments.name: Q3 2024 Newman Mine Asset Management Assessment
assessments.description: Mining Operations Assessment - comprehensive evaluation of work management, defect elimination, asset strategy and asset health at Newman iron ore operations

objectives.title: Optimize Work Management and Maintenance Planning Effectiveness
objectives.description: Evaluate and enhance the systematic identification, planning, scheduling, execution, and analysis of maintenance work to achieve >90% schedule compliance and reduce unplanned maintenance interventions across critical mining equipment and infrastructure.

objectives.title: Strengthen Asset Reliability and Defect Elimination Capabilities
objectives.description: Assess current defect identification processes and root cause analysis methodologies to establish robust defect elimination programs that reduce equipment-related production losses by 15% and extend asset life cycles through proactive maintenance strategies.

objectives.title: Enhance Integrated Asset Health and Safety Performance
objectives.description: Review asset health monitoring systems, condition-based maintenance practices, and safety integration to ensure all critical equipment operates within optimal parameters while maintaining zero harm standards and maximizing operational availability.

responses.question_ref: Problem Statement and Team Charter Developmen
Loss Prevention and Continuous Learning System
Problem Statement and Team Charter Developmen
Loss Prevention and Continuous Learning System

assessments.name: Q3 2024 Mt. Aurthur Mine Asset Management Assessment
assessments.description: Mining Operations Assessment - comprehensive evaluation of work management, defect elimination, asset strategy and asset health at Newman iron ore operations

objectives.title: Improve Maintenance Planning and Execution Standards for Coal Operations
objectives.description: Assess and optimize maintenance work identification, planning, scheduling and execution processes to achieve >85% planned work completion and minimize dragline equipment downtime through enhanced preventive maintenance strategies and resource utilization.

objectives.title: Develop Comprehensive Defect Elimination and Asset Strategy Framework
objectives.description: Evaluate existing failure analysis capabilities and asset tactics development to implement systematic defect elimination processes that reduce coal handling equipment failures by 20% and optimize dragline maintenance intervals through data-driven decision making.

objectives.title: Advance Asset Health Monitoring and Operational Risk Management
objectives.description: Review condition monitoring programs, predictive maintenance technologies, and risk assessment processes to ensure dragline operations maintain peak performance while achieving continuous improvement in safety standards and production reliability targets.

responses.question_ref: Problem Statement and Team Charter Developmen
Loss Prevention and Continuous Learning System
Problem Statement and Team Charter Developmen
Loss Prevention and Continuous Learning System

score_1.title: Develop Comprehensive Training Program
score_1.description: Create a structured training curriculum for work identification and notification creation, including site-specific materials and SAP training modules.

score_1.title: Identify Training Recipients
score_1.description: Conduct a skills gap analysis to identify all personnel who require work identification training, including operators, maintainers, and contractors.

score_1.title: Establish Training Documentation
score_1.description: Develop standardized training materials, procedures, and assessment criteria for work identification processes.

score_2.title: Increase Training Coverage
score_2.description: Expand training program to achieve 75% coverage of identified personnel, focusing on consistent application of work identification principles.

score_2.title: Improve Work Coding Accuracy
score_2.description: Implement refresher training and quality checks to ensure emergent work is correctly coded and classified in the system.
